item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3713] Desktop - Exeter - Decision Feature - As a consumer, I want to apply for financing on exeterfinance.com to save time at the dealership.
item.author: Jeremi Sanders
item.description:
Decision configurability has now been added to the Finance Driver Configuration in Admin.

For DT accounts, a Default type will be required while for Chase, all types but Default will be required.

There is a new upgrader that will initially populate any DT accounts using FD with the current default decision info that was previously hard-coded. Any Chase accounts will also be updated but they will be pre-populated with the previously hard-coded Pending,Approved,Declined, and CounterOffer types.

Three hooks ($d, $v, $n) can be inserted into the texts (not titles) of each decision config if desired. Suite will replace these hooks with the corresponding info (Dealer Name, Vehicle, and Customer Name respectively). We were doing this in a few places.

There is an email title and text that can be set for each decision that will show up in customer emails.

Admin b183
Suite b382


Author: Jeremi Sanders (DTINSIDE-3713)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3743] FD Long Form: Properly formatted emails are being rejected
item.author: Christine Norstrand
item.description:
c.com is not a valid domain name. There are a limited number of valid single letter domains:

In 1993, IANA reserved the remaining single-letter and single-digit domain names and with the following exceptions listed below, are not in use. The few that were already were grandfathered in and continued to exist:

i.net
q.com
q.net
x.com
x.org
z.com
w.org
x.com

Any others are illegal. I'd be surprised if we're checking for that.


All of the two-letter domains are in use, however.

The local part of the email address does allow a single letter, per the RFC 822. Even outlook allows it.

Sometimes I know things.

Author: Christine Norstrand (DTINSIDE-3743)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3713] Desktop - Exeter - Decision Feature - As a consumer, I want to apply for financing on exeterfinance.com to save time at the dealership.
item.author: Tim Henwood
item.description:
JAD - 2-19-13 Decision was made to make this a minimal configuration to the Desktop and Mobile UI only. Configuration points will be the Decision section, Next Steps, and Important Information. All other features of the page are hard-coded.

Decision and Important Information section configuration will be part of the FD workflow setup.
Next Steps will remain in Admin in present location, so decision page will have to be configured in two areas of Admin (for now).

A new story needs to be added for next sprint to apply configuration to email. And if the FD short-form should also be configurable, then add a new story for that customization. Also recommended is to add another story to redesign how Next Steps is formatted in Admin so that depending on ending workflow (TD, Lead, FD) Next Steps is specific to that ending point.

Author: Tim Henwood (DTINSIDE-3713)
Edited by: Tim Henwood

item.author: Chris Sanders
item.description:

Yung had mentioned the vehicle section not showing when no vehicle is in scope but then appearing when a vehicle is selected via the YMMS selector in the long form. This would be too disruptive to the code base to do right now, especially in light of 2sweet redesign upcoming which will change how the margin is built and handled anyway. This isn't defined as a requirement for this story so I'm not going to implement that piece. I'm not sure it will even play into Exeter case which will have a vehicle selector up front anyway.

Implemented so no vehicle section is shown if the vehicle is not in scope, nor will it appear for the final 2 screens of the form when the vehicle is chosen on the vehicle screen of the long form.

Author: Chris Sanders (DTINSIDE-3707)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3616] Sec: White Hat Test Remediation - Current
item.author: Damon Kleckler
item.description:
b380 has the two fixes that MUST be in before the end of the sprint: *839 and *848.

Testing *848 is easy. If the email link still exists or something is clearly broken then I made badness happen.

Testing *839 requires watching the GWT RPC traffic when the results login page is used. If you enter a valid reference code but a bad password against b379, you should see the entire status entity coming back from the RPC call to getLenderDecisionStatus(). A technically-savvy user could use this to mine the database for any saved responses so long as he could guess valid reference codes. Now you will see that the status entity does not come back unless both the ref code and the password are valid.
To look at the GWT RPC traffic, you'll need to use Chrome's developer tools (F12) and the network tab in particular. Click the "XHR" button to limit what's in view to just the RPC traffic.

Author: Damon Kleckler (DTINSIDE-3616)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3704] Decide on as a team what our code review process is
item.author: Damon Kleckler
item.description:
We had our meeting on the 25th. In general everyone was on-board with the standards Mark had outlined on the wiki.
Mark will create the Intellij formatting profile and Damon will create one for Eclipse. These will be posted on the wiki in the team process section.
We'll be reviewing a select group of stories at the end of this sprint (Wednesday).
Going forward we'll be reviewing stories on an individual basis (1 on 1) with an end-of-sprint session to go over stories of interest to the team.
The consensus was to have code review come prior to code being released to QA, but we agreed that we need to "practice reviewing as a team" for at least one sprint before adopting that process.

Author: Damon Kleckler (DTINSIDE-3704)

- Prequal / Finance Driver

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3683] Mobile - Editing Mileage Clears equipment and history options
item.author: Mark Bennett
item.description:
This sounds pretty annoying from a user-perspective, but there's a reason we do this: TradeDriver potentially returns different questions/answers for the same vehicle with different mileage. So we currently re-fetch all the questions from TD every time the "vehicle" changes, which includes YMMSS, state, and mileage.

I don't think we can change the underlying behavior, but maybe there's a way it could be more user-friendly. I'll check with Yung to see what she thinks.

Author: Mark Bennett (DTINSIDE-3683)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3599] 2Sweet - Mobile - TD - Vehicle Selector - As a consumer, I want to use the tabbing feature on my phone to select my vehicle to save time.
item.author: Damon Kleckler
item.description:
Questions:
* How many mobile devices have this capability. (this addresses severity)
** So far we've only noticed this capability on the iPhone.
* Do lists populate on the iPhone once the RPC call comes back? (this impacts how we fix it)
** No. This means that so long as it is still possible for a user to click 'next' before the list has loaded, they can still get stuck with an empty list. This probably means that server-side caching will not be sufficient to reliably "fix" the issue by the time you figure cell network transport cost and other overhead.



Author: Damon Kleckler (DTINSIDE-3599)
Edited by: Damon Kleckler

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3599] 2Sweet - Mobile - TD - Vehicle Selector - As a consumer, I want to use the tabbing feature on my phone to select my vehicle to save time.
item.author: Damon Kleckler
item.description:
Attached is a file of all the raw YMMSS string for TradeDriver, with hierarchy un-duplicated.
So, "2015KiaSorentoEX4D Utility4D Utility AWDLimited4D Utility4D Utility AWDLX4D Utility4D Utility AWD4D Utility AWD V64D Utility V6SX4D Utility4D Utility AWD", represents all the unique identifiers for 2015 Kia.
For BlackBook's data set going back to 2004 this comes to 263K of string data. This compresses using gzip to around 22K.

Expecting that Chrome's dataset is more like 45K compressed (goes back to '97), it seems reasonable to cache the datasets on the client if we need to. Certainly caching them server-side is not an issue.

The trick if we decide to cache will be pulling down each data set quickly and in a minimal form. Pulling this down serially over the VPN using the existing TD API took 45m and pulled down over a gig of json. Changes will need to be made to TD and some other service (for Chrome data) to expose a single "snapshot" call.

Author: Damon Kleckler (DTINSIDE-3599)
Edited by: Damon Kleckler

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3655] Consumer Email Bcc -Behavior Broken when To address is bogus or in filtered domain.
item.author: Jeremi Sanders
item.description:
I did have a discussion with Ramsi. I think he was thinking that was prior functionality when he told you that. But we decided that it was unnecessary to send a BCC email if the user either put in the wrong address or the address was one in which we didnt want to send any emails (in the demo filter). Any valid leads (from valid user emails) will still be BCC'd.

Author: Jeremi Sanders (DTINSIDE-3655)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-2806] Get Rid of Unused Code in SWL and Suite
item.author: Damon Kleckler
item.description:
Suite:
* We should kill the TD multi-dealer flow while we're in here. I discussed this with Al and he doesn't see any need to keep this.
* Construct 4.8 code on the server and in shared can be killed since we're not doing B&P or model search.
* The model-based comparison code and everything related to ClientModelServiceImpl can probably go, but some vestiges may need to stick around for the inventory comparison.

SWL server/rpc:
* The mediaserver code isn't required anymore. This is a deprecated Chrome service that we don't use.
* The construct 4.8 code isn't used. Construct 3 we'll want to keep, but if we ever build a config/compare service we'll need to rebuild the modern-Construct code anyway.

SWL shared:
* accs - This is for Construct 4.8 and shouldn't be needed.
* The MarketBasket stuff isn't used.

SWL client:
* it'd be nice to tweak the comparison UI and kill the last of ThreeBoxButton


Author: Damon Kleckler (DTINSIDE-2806)
Edited by: Damon Kleckler

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3655] Consumer Email Bcc -Behavior Broken when To address is bogus or in filtered domain.
item.author: Diksha Kakkar
item.description:
i had checked with Ramsi on that .
Ramsi's comments --
Any time the Suite attempts to generate an email, whether it does so successfully or not the BCC should be generated..

Jeremi --can you check with Ramsi ?

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3624] 2Sweet - Mobile - TD - Offer - As a consumer, I want to get a trade estimate to save time at the dealer.
item.author: Diksha Kakkar
item.description:
This behavior is the expected one --AC7 needs to be updated ( discussed with Al with Tim )
Given: That I've gotten a trade-in value without anything owed.
When: I get the trade-in value
And: I've indicated that I owe money on my trade-in.
TD Offer does not check Amount owed in TD flow but amount owed will be shown in PD page and taken into consideration for payments .

Tested all ACs---

1.I see the ability to view my offer. ----
 Completed flow --can see my offer
2. I see the ability to go back and make changes
. -- Does not really fit into here ..related with Start /chang vehicle if TD not complete
3. I can see my offer without entering contact info.
-- Contact info not asked in TD flow
4. If i see my offer, I see that I can start over but all information is lost.
-After TD is complete , click on start , see popup shown to alert info is cleared and
Checked Two things -- Choose same vehicle as earlier after clicking on start ( see in bugs on this behavior)
                             --Choose different vehicle as earlier after clicking on start
5. I see lead submission delayed as we do today for desktop. -- NOT CHECKED YET as of today
6. If I go back to purchase options and go back to TD, I only see my offer. -- Verified and see bug in list
7. I see the offer as the net adjusted value if the user enters what they owe. -- AC 7 --is changed see clarification in comments first line and working fine

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3660] SuiteDemo -Inventory Plus is not optimized for android and User agent ( Chrome browser)
item.author: Darrel Bonner
item.description:
Diksha, what were you testing with?

George reported that the S3 was displaying the old page and after investigation determined that it was due to the Default Browser reporting the device-width and resolution values incorrectly. device-width was being reported as resolution and vice-versa. I have made a change to address this and have tested it on the S3 and the Galaxy Victory Android phones.

the fix will be in b54.

Note: The issue I reported with Chrome showing the old page after going between landscape and portrait has also been fixed.

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3533] [External] Load Balancer configuration to support Zero-downtime deployments
item.author: Darrel Bonner
item.description:
[Dev-Int, QA] Remedy Ticket: CRQ000000008946

Note: [DR, PROD] ticket will be created once Steve says that the first one looks good.

Contents of the request:
------------------------------
Dev-Int Load Balancer: 10.136.16.18
Servers to check: [drsebsweb01di, drsebsweb02di]
Port: 8080

QA Load Balancer: 74.200.100.118
Servers to check: [drsebsweb01q, drsebsweb02q]
Port: 8080

----------
Rule Changes:

Overview:
Instead of using <host>/Suite/info to check the status of the server we are going to switch to using '<host>/Suite/lb_healthcheck' which will return HTTP 200 'Healthy' when it is healthy and accepting requests and HTTP 200 'Not accepting traffic'.

Details:
If the response from '<host>/Suite/lb_healthcheck' is not HTTP 200 'Healthy' remove from pool.

If the response from '<host>/Suite/lb_healthcheck' is HTTP 200 'Healthy' add (or keep) in the pool.
------------------------------


Author: Darrel Bonner (DTINSIDE-3533)
Edited by: Darrel Bonner

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3616] Sec: White Hat Test Remediation - Current
item.author: Damon Kleckler
item.description:
Damon's original analysis as reported to the security team:

44325848 - /FinanceService - Sev 4
Summary: 'Email this page' request can be modified to send to any email address with content changed.
Resolution: Al is amenable to removing this functionality entirely, but will need to clear it with Chase.

44325838 - /index.html - Sev 3
Summary: Spoofing using YMMS deep-link parameters displayed in header.
Resolution: This should not be considered a security issue. By getting the user to click a link to our application, an attacker could show the user bogus YMMS data or images. At the point that the user is clicking a link provided by an attacker the security game is already lost. Any such links can-and-would go directly to an exploit site. Similarly, a dealer or OEM could attack their own users by crafting malicious embeds, but it would be much easier to attack them directly since the users are already on the dealer's site.

44325995 - /util/print/html-to-pdf - Sev 3
Summary: Attacker can generate a PDF with arbitrary content.
Resolution: This is not a security vulnerability. While a malicious user could generate PDFs for free, the PDF is returned directly to the caller of the service, so, this cannot be used to alter another user's PDF responses. This could allow malicious callers to generate PDFs for free or DoS our service at best. A technically savvy user could modify their trade-in valuation, but such a user could much more easily edit the resulting PDF using any free PDF editor.

44326419 - 400 response - Sev 1
Summary: Displays apache/tomcat version number.
Resolution: We will override this page, it is identified as very minor threat.

44326112 - /FinanceService - Sev 2
Summary: No anti-automation for service calls. Attacker could DoS the DT deal queue.
Resolution: Ramsi previously discussed this with Piyush in security and Piyush agreed this was not an issue. Existing DT products like credit online already do this.

44325839 - /FinanceService Login Page - Sev 4
Summary: Three-letters of last name validated on client side, after LDR content is already on the client.
Resolution: This is a very legitimate issue and we will fix it. Fortunately, no PII is leaked as a result of this, but it's definitely worth fixing.

Author: Damon Kleckler (DTINSIDE-3616)
Edited by: Damon Kleckler

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3621] Payment Widget button does not open page if using mobile device
item.author: Damon Kleckler
item.description:
b353
This should now be resolved. If suite.js is injecting a payment widget AND it detects that it is being accessed by a mobile device, it will float a div over the iframe. The new div will intercept the click event when the user presses on it and launch the suite. Since this new div is part of the main page and not our iframe content (third-party site), popup blockers will allow the popup.

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3607] BUG- error when selecting incentives
item.author: Damon Kleckler
item.description:
This exposes a long standing bug:
When you start with a term that excludes a given incentive and then toggle back to a term that allows the incentive, the incentive WILL appear, but it's value will be $0. There is no existing concept of updating that cash value based on term selections.

I've fixed this in the mobile UI, but it's going to be risky to fix in the desktop UI and is an edge case.

b350 fixes this for mobile, but not for the desktop. That fix is too risky given our NADA deadline. Please keep this bug open, but move it to the backlog.

Author: Damon Kleckler (DTINSIDE-3607)
Edited by: Damon Kleckler

It definitely doesn't need to be addressed before NADA as this is our current expected behaviour, however, it would be a better user experience to change our behaviour so that the user can enter anything and we'll only strip the characters FD doesn't like immediately before submission to that service. Then, when FD is fixed, we can just remove that regex replace.

Author: Damon Kleckler (DTINSIDE-3603)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3603] Lien Holder does not accept authentic bank names
item.author: Damon Kleckler
item.description:
This is being enforced because we pass the value on to FD and FD has certain character restrictions on the field.

According to the FD docs, they accept:
[a-zA-Z0-9\s4\-/\.,]+[a-zA-Z0-9\s4\-/\.,8]*

This is, however, a lie. The examples listed in the description cause validation errors in FinanceDriver's credit app endpoint.

Author: Damon Kleckler (DTINSIDE-3603)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3384] 2Sweet - Mobile - TD - Vehicle Description - As a consumer, I want to get a trade estimate to save time at the dealer.
item.author: Damon Kleckler
item.description:
Darrel noted a risk in pre-grooming tied to BlackBook data set updates. We glossed over it, assuming it wouldn't affect us, but I believe it's still a concern.

When we create the /lead in DT.COM we pass in the offer data we're creating the lead for. TD re-calculates the offer based on its current data set to ensure the caller isn't trying to submit a bogus offer. If the BlackBook data set has changed between when the offer was generated and when the lead is submitted, this value could be innocently different. We need to consider a way to handler this, because:

If we wait to submit the lead AND the consumer is working late at night around when the data load occurs, there is a chance (10%?) that the TD submission will fail. If they value their trade and then work on a long form, there'll definitely be enough gap in their session to allow this possibility.

Author: Damon Kleckler (DTINSIDE-3384)
Edited by: Damon Kleckler

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3577] Bug-Changing TD value in PD/FD screen still sendsTD voucher value in emai
item.author: Jeremi Sanders
item.description:
Because of existence of original Trade-In from TD workflow, even after user modifies the TradeIn and a UserTradeIn is created, the tradeInIsSystemProvided flag was being reset to true because of the continued existence of original system obtained Trade-In on context.

Now we are clearing that Trade-In from context and pointing our updateLeadContact method to the user Trade-in if it exists. This way the flag correctly reflects the existence of either system TradeIn or user TradeIn and we get the appropriate TradeIn detail structure in our customer emails while still submitting the original TradeIn from TD workflow to the TD service.

So now, if the user first goes through TD workflow to get a Trade-in and then chooses to discard that and make manual edits to the TradeIn info on Credit App, we will then show that custom info on the emails.

b345

Author: Jeremi Sanders (DTINSIDE-3577)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3475] 2Sweet - Mobile - PD - Incentives - As a consumer, I want the ability to select discounts available to me.
item.author: Tim Henwood
item.description:
TEST PLAN
Most tests should be executed for both Finance and Lease tabs.

TC1 - Base State
1) Find vehicles with cash discounts and incentives
2) Using the same URL parameter (with vehicles found in step 1) compare the discounts and incentives on the desktop and mobile versions - they should match
3) Name, description, condition (only if IsStandardRebate is false), expiration date, and value of incentives should match.
4) Compare the SOAP response and verify the UI is displaying all available discounts and incentives

TC2 - Incentive Selection
1) Apply one incentive on both versions.
* Prices should match.
* "Discounts" should include total incentive value. "Net Price" should be "Selling Price" less "Discounts".
* Due at signing should change.
2) Apply a second incentive. Verify as in 1.
3) Go back to purchase options and verify indicated payment.
4) De-select incentives. Verify as in 1 and that all of UI matches base state.
5) Go back to purchase options and verify indicated payment.

TC3 - Lead
1) Select a set of incentives (more than one).
2) Submit lead
3) Verify lead includes correct incentives (HTML and ADF).

TC4 - Only Incentives for Selected Finance Method (Loan/Lease) Are Displayed
1) Find a vehicle in PD that has incentives applying only to loan, lease, and both. (FinanceMethod=Loan,Lease,AllMethodsApply)
2) Ensure that mobile and desktop show only the incentives for their particular method and those applicable to both methods (AllMethodsApply).

TC5 - Incentives Excluding Other Incentives
1) Find vehicle with incentives that exclude each other.
2) Examine PD results in SoapUI to identify correct exclusion behaviour.
3) Toggle one incentive.
4) Toggle an excluding incentive.
* Prior incentive de-selected.
* Payment adjusted and appropriate for just the currently selected incentive. Payment matches desktop.
* Payment breakdown (discounts, net price) are correct.
5) Submit lead.
6) Lead shows correct incentive set.

TC6 - Incentives Excluding Programs
1) Find a vehicle where an incentive excludes certain rate programs.
2) Examine PD results in SoapUI to identify correct exclusion behaviour.
3) Toggle excluding incentive.
* Prior rate program replaced with next-best non-excluded program.
* Payment adjusted and correct. Payment matches desktop.
* Payment breakdown correct.
4) Submit lead.
5) Lead shows correct incentive AND rate.

TC7 - "Hide Conditional Incentives" Setting Honored
1) Check "Hide Conditional Incentives" in Admin for the test dealer.
2) Ensure that mobile and desktop UIs do not show any portion of the conditional incentives UI.
3) Ensure that lead does not include any conditional incentives.

TC8 - Mutually Excluding Customer Cash Treated as Conditional Incentive
1) Find a case where two standard cash incentives exclude each other.
2) Ensure that the mobile and desktop UIs treat these just like conditional incentives, instead of bundling them inline as customer cash.

TC9 - Customer Cash Conditional Incentives Not Shown If "Ignore Cash Incentives" is Checked
Same as TC7, but check the "ignore cash incentives" setting in Admin.
Cash incentives should not appear either by the rate or in the conditional incentives section.

Negative
TC - $0 Priced Vehicle
TC - No lease
TC - No payments from PD
TC - No conditional incentives from PD

Out-of-Scope Pending Other Stories
TC - Conditional Incentives Work with Custom Rate

Un-Testable
TC - Expired incentives are not shown (End Date)
TC - Yet-to-Start incentives are not shown (Start Date)
TC - Expired rates/programs/cash incentives are not shown

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3458] 2Sweet - Mobile - PD - Lease - As a consumer, I want the ability customize my lease payments.
item.author: Christine Norstrand
item.description:
8 January 2014 Update:

1. I see the ability to select lease as a payment option. - Automation Complete
2. I see the available lease program. - Automation Complete
3. I see a default term with the ability to modify it. - Automation Complete
3. I see a default down payment with the ability to modify it. - Automation Complete
4. I see the ability to enter a trade in value. - Automation Complete
5. I see the ability to enter the amount I owe on my trade. - Automation Complete
6. I see a default annual miles with the ability to modify it. - Automation Complete
7. I see my lease program broken out in detail. - Automation Complete
8. I see "Other" to represented a detail value that the system cannot identify. *Hold for more data per Damon
9. I see I always have the ability to return to my purchase options from the workflow. - Automation in Progress
10. I see my monthly payment on my purchase options after I've completed the workflow. - Automation in Progress
11. I see the ability to progress to the next workflow after I finish the monthly payment workflow. - Not started
12. There should never be "Enter your own rate" functionality on this screen - Not Started
13. Credit Score, Conditional Incentives, and Return to/Add Trade-in functionality will be added as a separate story - Separate stories
14: User can switch between Finance and Lease and all information is preserved between both - Automation complete
15. Adheres to Truth in Lending Act monthly lease payment disclosure rules (discuss and record in future JAD) (see comments)
16. Desktop workflow is unaffected

Author: Christine Norstrand (DTINSIDE-3458)

* Selling Price on lease side changed to "Est. Capitalized Cost"
* Amount Financed on lease side changed to "Adj. Capitalized Cost"

* "Monthly Payment" on lease side changed to "Est. Lease Payment"

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3515] NADA Prequal Optional Middle Initial
item.author: Jeremi Sanders
item.description:
THe "MI (Optional)" text is placeholder text. It will show if assigned for that field and if the field is empty. Will only go away if there is a value placed in the field. An empty field is not a value. This is by design. The final submitted name will not have a middile initial as none was given. But the field will continue to display the placeholder (help) text for that field provided it has not value. The style for placeholder text could be adjusted so that it is a lighter gray.

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3474] Zero-downtime deploys
item.author: Mark Bennett
item.description:
This is done except for the load balancer config change, which I think should be a separate story, since it really can't happen until this story is fully deployed to an environment. For testing this one, here's how it should work:

Suite will be available in the load balancer for customer traffic only if the following 2 conditions hold:
1. /Suite/info returns a 200 HTTP status code
2. /Suite/lb_healthcheck contains the string "Healthy" in its response

The "new" deploy mechanism divides the servers in an environment into 2 groups, and deploys to them in the following manner:

1. The first group is modified such that /Suite/lb_healthcheck no longer returns "Healthy".
2. A period of time is waited (currently 90 seconds) for any current transactions to finish.
3. The first group are deployed to with the new versions of Suite/Admin/SuiteDemo.
4. Once the first group is fully up, they are modified to again return "Healthy", fully enabling them in the load balancer again.
5. The second group is disabled to no longer return "Healthy".
6. A period of time is again waited for current transactions to the second group to complete.
7. The second group is deployed to.
8. Once fully back up, the second group is modified to again return "Healthy". At this point, all servers are fully enabled in the load balancer with the new versions of the applications.

I can assist with testing this process. From my perspective, the key pieces are:
* There is always at least one fully-functional server accepting traffic in the load balancer.
* The period of time when servers with different versions of the app are enabled in the load balancer at the same time is minimized.


Author: Mark Bennett (DTINSIDE-3474)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3505] BUG: Suite.js - Resize event on widget load causing null reference
item.author: Jeremi Sanders
item.description:
Adjusted drs.resizeFrame method to account for drs.modal or drs.modalFrame being null if we happen be calling a resize before the modal actually exists.

The call to resize is coming from preloading the PD details view which needs to happen to make sure that the height is correct when the modal is eventually displayed. (When this call was not present, we would end up with a modal opened that had no height for some reason. Showed the vail but could not see the modal.)

b325

Hi Ramsi,

I know that Tom had posed the question about no MSRP data in the source files but am not sure if there was a reply in that email chain.

Let me know if you have any questions after you review.

Thanks,
Scott Jackson

Services Sales and F&I Solutions
Dealertrack Technologies
p 516.300.4407
f 630.618.3935
www.dealertrack.com

Ramsi Hawkins

item.author: Jeremi Sanders
item.description:

Because this is an extension of a new Prequal abstract, the Mobile form utilizes the same field IDs as the normal Prequal form with some additions - the validate email field and rural route fields.

When we press submit, the user will be taken to a developer ThankYou page for the scope of this story.

Note: Error boxes do not currently carry fine tuned debug IDs. They are merely given a "val.err06" type of generic ID. If we are wanting specific IDs on the error boxes themselves, this would be in the scope of another story.

Suite b318

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3482] BUG: Datalogix pixel not firing
item.author: Jeremi Sanders
item.description:
This is not a bug in the Datalogix analytics functionality. Suite is properly loading the datalogix pixel url that is set in EBIZ Suite.xml which was currently "http://localhost"

This simply needs to be changed to whatever URL you are wanting to have put there for that environment. Not sure why it was set to localhost.

Author: Jeremi Sanders (DTINSIDE-3482)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3482] BUG: Datalogix pixel not firing
item.author: Ramsi Hawkins
item.description:
Instead of actually sending a request off to the URL stored in JNDI, we're sending off a request to "localhost%26rand%3D<a string of numbers that I assume is a Unix time stamp>". I know that this is probably goofy code that's hard to follow (which might be a good argument for a healthy refactor), but it's pretty important to actually test that fixes actually fix things before tossing them back to QA.

Author: Ramsi Hawkins (DTINSIDE-3482)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3356] Develop automated testing framework
item.author: Damon Kleckler
item.description:
The scope of this ticket has been altered in various meetings since it's origination. It appears the story has never been updated. The current plan is to have:
* the python/behave/selenium framework usable by Damon, Christine, and Darrel
* support for user-agent masquerading so a desktop browser can test the mobile UI
* a minimal set of executable tests targeting the new mobile UI
* a minimal set of tests and instrumentation targeting the Chase desktop UI

Specifically, these items are NOT in scope:
* Jenkins integration





Author: Damon Kleckler (DTINSIDE-3356)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3144] SmartFind: Auth file parsing breaks on trailing spaces
item.author: Damon Kleckler
item.description:
Darrel:
There's a settable() flag on CSVReader to "ignoreTrailingCharacters". Good chance if this is set the problem will go away.

Whoever picks this up should look at modifying the FileReadingRowProviderFactory, etc., to take advantage of this flag.

Author: Damon Kleckler (DTINSIDE-3144)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3383] 2Sweet - Mobile - As a consumer, I want vehicle details on the Purchase Options page
item.author: Chris Sanders
item.description:
308
Note: In a production environment, the options would be driven by the workflows enabled on the account that support mobile. For this story, we need to override that a little bit so we can see how this screen works and verify it works prior to actually having the option screens built yet for mobile.

In 308, the trade option shows as completed, with a trade value instead of a Start button and a check in a circle instead of a trade icon. This is normal behavior for a completed option.

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3402] Update online implementer documentation with URL parameters and rules
item.author: Ramsi Hawkins
item.description:
This is definitely an improvement and I will close this as far as this sprint's scope is concerned. Here are some notes though on where to go from here:

Implementer Documentation Notes

Introduction
-Using PD Widgets overview should change to just geing any workflow combination that starts with PaymentDriver

Using Custom Buttons
-I would remove "(if you are using a workflow that does not start with SmartFind), " since it is a little confusing without context

Using Suite Widgets
-Vehicles used for examples should be updated to something newer (with a lease for the new, and with a program for the used)

Embedding Suite
-Is modalMaxW actually applicable here?

Suite Query String & URLs
-We'll want a section on starting in a TradeDriver workflow
-Need to overhaul this page further since none of our criteria (other than accountId and dealerId) are cut and dry. Things were already complex when we were talking about ALG descriptor vs styleId, then we added VIN to the table, but not the "PaymentDriver URL Criteria" section. Now, the addition of SmartFind deep-linking makes everything except VIN optional.

FAQ
-There are a number of questions we get fairly frequently that should be added related to:
--size inheritance from parent elements
--"Q: my stuff doesn't work" "A: should you be using the async loading section?"
--widget type listed in header vs body

Author: Ramsi Hawkins (DTINSIDE-3402)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3402] Update online implementer documentation with URL parameters and rules
item.author: Paul Leineweber
item.description:
Spoke with Jeremi who agreed a new section for URL parameters would be good (as per DTINSIDE-3402 Design Proposal 20131118.docx) and he proposed that it might be a good idea to add this additional AC (and I agree):
"Legacy sections linked from the https://porebiz1.dt.inc/SuiteDemo/imp_introduction.jsp page (Custom Budget Widgets, PaymentDriver Widgets) that discuss parameters (in the context of specifying suiteQueryString Attributes) are revised to remove parameterization details and instead refer to the new “Using URL Parameters” section” so that redundancies in the online documentation are reduced, and the burden of maintaining the online documentation is reduced if and when the parameters used by Suite change in the future."
Al agreed with design/approach so dev work can begin.
 


Author: Paul Leineweber (DTINSIDE-3402)
Edited by: Paul Leineweber

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3435] BUG: Integrated TD flow crashes the app on Chrome
item.author: Chris Sanders
item.description:
304
This was an issue of the credit view being a handler for the trade view as if the trade view is a section of the credit app. When it is, that's ok, but when it's not, like in the case of this bug, where it is opened as a modal from the payment view, trying to adjust the height of the app based on elements in the credit view which isn't even showing, isn't going to work as expected. This fix makes the credit view only adjust height if it's actually being shown.

Author: Chris Sanders (DTINSIDE-3435)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3408] BUG- iPad fields are non-functional if you remove prior input
item.author: Jeremi's OLD ACCOUNT
item.description:
This is a strange issue. Seems like the browser loses focus on the field after the delete happens but the browser doesn't fire any blur event. So you are left with the keyboard as if your in the field, but the field doesn't get any of the input as if you have no focus on it.

Tapping on the field a second time actually looks like it blurs out of it but I don't see any error and no event is fired. I have to actually tap a third time to get the change and blur events to fire and the error box to show up because there is no value. Then tap a fourth time to edit the field again...

Author: Jeremi's OLD ACCOUNT (DTINSIDE-3408)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3414] Check that secondary income amounts do not total more than $999,999
item.author: Mark Bennett
item.description:
We still pass the "other" income (the sum of the 2nd through 6th incomes) as a monthly value, which FD allows up to 999,999. With only 6 digits now allowed in each of these 5 annual "other" fields, a user can only pass up to 4,999,995 annually, which is 416,666 monthly, well under 999,999. So with the new 6 digit requirement, there is no way to go over FD's limits. Testable in Suite b299.

Author: Mark Bennett (DTINSIDE-3414)

Author: Jeremi's OLD ACCOUNT (DTINSIDE-3410)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3399] BUG: SOA - Printing on tablets is broken
item.author: Damon Kleckler
item.description:
https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=1780

This isn't too hard to fix on the iPad (separate window instead of hidden iframe), but Android apparently has a long-standing bug that it doesn't handle binary response streams to POSTs properly. Since the content we're sending is pretty ugly to encode as URL parameters, we're probably left with two options:
* Kill PDF on tablets (Al approves, so long as email is available).
* Generate the PDF and store it tied to a relative URL that is returned from the form POST, then download that doc separately using a simple GET.

Author: Damon Kleckler (DTINSIDE-3399)

item.author: Jeremi's OLD ACCOUNT
item.description:
Field was throwing multiple validations. With new validation handling, we are only showing the last in MultiValidation or most recent validation from that source. We are now able to properly see validation from letters being input instead of numbers in addition to regular validation cases.

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-2463] Which Sprint 39-49 stories need doc updates?
item.author: Paul Leineweber
item.description:
Closing this story 2463 because it's too big to be completed in a single sprint. Smaller manageable stories can be created instead.
I created the 2463 story April 5, 2013 to identify what had changed in Sprint 39 so product documentation could be kept up in a timely manner. The story's been deferred ever since and there are now over ten sprints of documentation debt. Based on July 2013 conversations I think it's still advisable to create stories as needed to:

1) Move the descriptions of Suite plug-ins, supported workflows, and account settings that prospects should be aware of from the last published DR Suite Implementation Guide ("Digital Retailing Suite 1.0 Implementation Guide 20130322.PDF"from March 2013) into a new "Suite Product Guide" so that interested stakeholders can read about Suite's product capabilities in a portable distributable doc written for a business audience.

2) Move Suite's technical implementation details content from "Digital Retailing Suite 1.0 Implementation Guide 20130322.PDF" to join the existing Suite Demo site's Implementer Documentation section (https://porebiz1.dt.inc/SuiteDemo/imp_introduction.jsp) so that frequently changing implementation details are maintainable in one place, and always available to implementers and technical readers who wish to read and learn about any of the many implementation variations in detail.

Author: Paul Leineweber (DTINSIDE-2463)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3290] BUG: Page transition button w/validations - mobile
item.author: Jeremi's OLD ACCOUNT
item.description:
Changed onClick to onMouseDown for AbstractCreditAppView.

This issue was happening because the removal of the validation from the layout was shifting the button positioning enough that by the time the mouseUp event fired, our click/touch was outside the original source. So no onClick was getting fired as a result.

By switching to onMouseDown, we are doing our stepping in the same event that is ultimately causing the layout change. This way we can still step if we validate within the same click/touch.

b292

Author: Jeremi's OLD ACCOUNT (DTINSIDE-3290)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3322] BUG- not enforcing minimum 960 px width for Subaru Frame
item.author: Chris Sanders
item.description:
I'm not sure limiting the width to minimum of 960px is the right solution. The app looks ok and is certainly usable to a much smaller width. Even when it starts to break down, the effects are minor and the app is still usable which leads me to feel that if the user wants (or needs) to have a browser so thin, the experience is far better with a thin app than a horizontal scroll bar and a clipped app.

Assigning to Al for final decision.

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3112] As a Suite/Subaru partner, I want field level validation error handling so that consumers can resolve issues as they navigate through the credit application.
item.author: Tim Henwood
item.description:
1) Income Fields > If you do not navigate to the income amount field you can go to the next page without any validation. These fields need to work together to validate the inputs

2) DOB> No edit check for year : 10/22/19

3) After error, navigation goes to bottom of page in footer section (mobile version)

4) some fields require pressing next button twice. enter an invalid phone number, press next button and get error. fix error and press next button - no navigation. press next button again and now you go to the next page.

5) WI married status is not popping up the WI spouse info section. I think this is happening if you get the state error required error validation to come up first.

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3196] As a product owner, I want to be able to track the Subaru workflow so that I can assess its' success.
item.author: Ramsi Hawkins
item.description:
Chase decisions and post login functionality have not yet been tested at this point due to environment issues with callbacks. Here are the issues surrounding what has been tested:

Issue 1:
Short & Long Form lead completion has the same ActionTitle.

Reproduction steps:
-https://porebiz1.dt.inc/Suite/?accountId=4&dealerId=100221&qaMode=true, submit a lead
-https://porebiz1.dt.inc/Suite/?accountId=3&dealerId=100221&qaMode=true, submit a lead
-login to clicky and notice both submit actions end up being "FinanceLeadSubmitted" so short and long submits become indistinguishable. This also means that in the BI report, both kinds of leads get transformed into the LongSubmit action

https://clicky.com/stats/visitors-actions?site_id=66583834&date=2013-10-25&session_id=995126113 gives an example of this if you scroll down to the bottom of the page and compare the Short Form and Long Form lead submit ActionTitles.

Issue 2:
Login page doesn't trigger an event

Reproduction steps:
-http://porebiz1.dt.inc/Suite/subaru/finance.html?accountId=401458&dealerId=1&year=2013&make=Subaru&model=BRZ&style=Limited&price=25692&msrp=27443&type=new&mileage=21&picture=http://www.subaru.com/content/images/my13/BRZ/nav_default.png#ResultsLoginPlace:Login
-Only the eBiz action is logged

Issue 3:
Mobile devices don't log partnerDealerId on the URL string

Reproduction steps:
-Open Chase workflow on a mobile device http://porebiz1.dt.inc/Suite/subaru/finance.html?accountId=401458&dealerId=1&year=2013&make=Subaru&model=BRZ&style=Limited&price=25692&msrp=27443&type=new&mileage=21&picture=http://www.subaru.com/content/images/my13/BRZ/nav_default.png
-All actions log as "/401458-Chase_Subaru_DXA_Long_Form_Account___Selenium-FA/1-x-EBS/ChaseMobile*"
"1-x-EBS" should be "1-1000250-EBS"

Author: Ramsi Hawkins (DTINSIDE-3196)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3340] BUG: Mobile - Date of Birth issues
item.author: Diksha Kakkar
item.description:
tested on b287.
accepts ( . / - as valid delimiter) all other as invalid
So accepted format is 11/11/1980, 11.11.1980 , 11-11-1980
 if i type two digit years , it converts it to four digit e.g
if i type 11/11/19 it accepts it as 1919
but problem occurs when i do 11/11/13 , system shows invalid birth date as it gets confused to pick 1913 or 2013.
i guess , that would be rare scenario to have DOB as 1913 or 2013

so passing to Tim/Ramsi to decide on that.



Author: Diksha Kakkar (DTINSIDE-3340)
Edited by: Diksha Kakkar

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3298] SOA/Suite - PDF - As a developer, I want to find a solution to print to .PDF.
item.author: Damon Kleckler
item.description:
The spike is effectively complete.

I've reviewed with Yung and Al the results of using FlyingSaucer to translate our HTML print pages to PDF and they are satisfied with the presentation. Well. Yung has no more concerns about the style than she has with the HTML version.

This allows us to continue creating content in HTML and CSS with a 'magic widget' that sends this content to the server where a PDF is created and returned to the UI with an 'attachment' 'Content-Disposition' so it will be saved with an indicated filename. While the CSS support is older (2.1) it is still far superior to what we have to deal with on the email side.

The name of the project is horrible, but it's probably the most main-stream, actively developed wrapper around iText, which itself is the main low-level PDF-generation library.

Author: Damon Kleckler (DTINSIDE-3298)

item.author: Ramsi Hawkins
item.description:
Zip code fields still aren't firing events, they should be.

In Chrome, all fields that they don't have a spec'd event are firing events using their Selenium Ids as the wa_frm_s. For instance:
-open in Chrome
-http://porebiz1.dt.inc/Suite/subaru/finance.html?accountId=401458&dealerId=1&year=2012&make=Subaru&model=BZ&style=premium&msrp=23000&picture=http://www.newyorker.com/online/blogs/photobooth/NASAEarth-01.jpg?_=1381266415086&fdTagName1=CustomTag1&fdTagValue1=3P0SUB00DN
-When phone type is selected I get the following event
https://www.chase.com/online/Home/images/wa01.gif?log=1&wa_cb=1381522466724…_pt=eBiz&wa_frm_n=CAF%20PersonalInfo&wa_frm_s=fd.app.app.phoneType&wa_tp=8

I'm yet to do an in depth test of field by field or complete browser until we're done getting full requirements from Chase on what all of these fields should look like, but I figure I'd kick these issues back to you so you can address them when you do those changes.

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3293] Subaru/Chase Welcome screen display issue with horizontal lines
item.author: Chris Sanders
item.description:
Won't Fix. See comments on 3311 regarding desktop suite min width allowance. These lines (as will other things in the UI) break at an app width below 700px.

Author: Chris Sanders (DTINSIDE-3293)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3311] Sub/Cha Intro screen not using dynamic sizing properly
item.author: Chris Sanders
item.description:
If I could mark this story as "Won't Fix" I would, but I can't, so I won't.

Suite has always had a minimum width requirement. According to the bootstrap script, suite.js, that min width is currently 700px. That is Yung's choice and the UI is built with that in mind... knowing it will always have at least 700px of width. If we squeeze the UI thinner than 700px, it's performance is undefined. Any issues at that point aren't bugs but rather just outside the realm of what suite is built to support.

Author: Chris Sanders (DTINSIDE-3311)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3295] Bug-Co Applicant Previous Address is getting dropped out if coapplicant selects YES for " same rent/mortgage as Applicant.
item.author: Mark Bennett
item.description:
To cover all the cases, I did the following: When "same rent/mortgage as applicant" is selected for the co-applicant, it will now show or not show the co-applicant's previous address section based on how long the applicant has lived in their primary address. If the applicant has less than 2 years, then in this case the co-applicant has an option to select "same address as applicant" for their previous address, which will just use the applicant's previous address. If they don't select this, then they'll need to enter a different previous address.

This will be available in Suite b281.

Author: Mark Bennett (DTINSIDE-3295)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3305] Bug-mobile-if privacy is footer link then it messes up display.
item.author: Damon Kleckler
item.description:
b281

Link-type footer items were not appearing as block-level elements. They would appear only as wide and high as their text. These should now be presented precisely the same as popup-type footer items.

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3296] BUG: Mobile Redirect Breaks with Chrome's Proxy Setup
item.author: Damon Kleckler
item.description:
Kevan has fixed their configuration upstairs, so this issue should be resolved with the exception that the redirect in preview switches from https to http (it does not do this in QA, so that's a config issue on IT's side). Obviously we couldn't go to production in this condition, but given that we'll go to production in NJ3, it's probably not worth troubleshooting this right now.

This link will work:
https://www.chromedata.com/Suite/subaru/finance.html?accountId=15740&dealerId=10172&year=2013&make=Subaru&model=BRZ&style=Limited&price=25692&msrp=27443&type=new&mileage=21&picture=http://www.subaru.com/content/images/my13/BRZ/nav_default.png&qaMode=true

Author: Damon Kleckler (DTINSIDE-3296)

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3210] BUG- URL without VIN is erroring when acct setup has SF lookup
item.author: Jeremi's OLD ACCOUNT
item.description:
Since SF Lookup relies on having a VIN and doesnt work without it, isnt this more of an account setup error? SF lookup should be turned off if they are not intending to use a VIN in the url. Then it will just use ADS.

Unless we are intending to support account setups that combine URLs with AND without VINs, we are designing around the configuration error and masking the actual error which is on the account setup.

Author: Jeremi's OLD ACCOUNT (DTINSIDE-3210)
Edited by: Jeremi's OLD ACCOUNT

item.title: RE: [DTINSIDE-3282] BUG: Login emails aren't being sent out and no logins for new applications are possible
item.author: Damon Kleckler
item.description:
This is not our issue. We've stopped receiving FD callbacks in QA.

If you use the FD Callback project for SoapUI, you can submit callbacks to our application successfully and see them appear in the log file. This proves that our handler is correctly logging callbacks.

If you then submit an application to a DXA dealer, you should see an app submission callback logged in our app log. If this doesn't appear (currently), then callbacks are broken on the FD side. At this point we need to get in touch with Saurabh or Vijay in NY to troubleshoot the problem.

Author: Damon Kleckler (DTINSIDE-3282)
